page.title: 10Farming in Whitsbury 1
page.content: Making up the Whitsbury Estate is a 1200 acre farm, a world famous stud farm and an equally renowned flat- race training stable.The estate had once been owned ,and greatly developed by the late{William Hill.} Whitsbury (Manor)Farm is a traditional downland farm,keeping cattle and sheep, and growing cereals. It supplies most of the feeding and bedding needs of the stud and racing stables but is particularly noted for its{Pedigree Friesian Herd}.It consistently produces show champions and is considered one of the top herds in the South of England. Additionally, the farm is involved in experimental work on increasing the 'genetic turnover' in cattle, and in embryo transplants for a leading Friesian breeding organization.
